thread.title: Volcanic Eruption Forces Closure of Four Indonesian Airports
thread.title_full: Volcanic Eruption Forces Closure of Four Indonesian Airports | MENAFN.COM

author: Qatar News Agency
title: Volcanic Eruption Forces Closure of Four Indonesian Airports
text:
(MENAFN - QNA) A volcanic eruption on Indonesia's Java island has forced the closure of four airports, including those on the popular tourist islands of Bali and Lombok, flag carrier Garuda Indonesia said Friday.

Mount Raung, located in East Java province, has been spewing ash and rocks since June, prompting authorities to raise its alert to the second highest level.

"As a result of the Mount Raung eruption, airports in Bali, Lombok, Jember and Banyuwangi are closed," Garuda said on its official Twitter feed.

"Flights to and from these airports have been cancelled," it said.

The 3,332-metre volcano erupted last year, with no human casualties.

Residents said they were prepared to evacuate if ordered to.

"We are worried after saw fire sparks last night," resident Nuriamah told Metro TV.

Indonesia is home to more than 130 active volcanoes, dpa reported.
